main_definition: To go or come after a person, thing, route, etc., in the same direction; to adhere to an example or rule.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Physically move behind someone or something
meanings_and_examples.example: The dog followed its owner as they walked down the street.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adhere to a set of rules, guidelines, or instructions
meanings_and_examples.example: Students must follow the school's code of conduct at all times.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Follow in the footsteps of someone as an example or model
meanings_and_examples.example: She decided to follow in her mother's footsteps and become a doctor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Keep up with a person, group, or vehicle
meanings_and_examples.example: I can't keep up with him when he runs; I always fall behind.
The popularity of electric cars is following the same trajectory as smartphones did in their early days.
